newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Air Lithuania cargo trade off 73.4 pct Jan-May y/y.
newsitem.headline: Air Lithuania cargo trade off 73.4 pct Jan-May y/y.

text.p: Lithuanian state-owned airline Air Lithuania Ltd said its cargo trade in the January-to-May period decreased 73.4 percent in 1996 from 1995.
CARGO TRADE (in tonnes) JAN-MAY 96 JAN-MAY 95 PCT CHANGE
NOTE - Cargo includes freight and mail.
In the balance, negative numbers indicate export deficits.
Air Lithuania, established in 1991, is owned completely by the Lithuanian state. It is under jurisdiction of the Ministry of Transport.
The airline carried cargo totalling 157.2 tonnes (3.8 tonnes exported; 153.4 tonnes imported) in 1995 and 53.7 tonnes (6.1 exported; 47.6 imported) in 1994.
Air Lithuania, which employs roughly 210 people, owns and operates an airplane fleet including six Yakovlev Yak-40s and one Tupolev Tu-134. It plans to buy one Aerospatiale ATR 42-300 by 1997.
Its hub is Karmelava Airport in Kaunas, Lithuania.

Air Lithuania offers five scheduled flights with cargo capacity from Kaunas: daily to Hamburg via Palanga, Lithuania; four times a week to Kristianstad, Sweden, via Palanga; twice weekly to Oslo via Palanga; twice weekly direct to Budapest; and twice weekly direct to Prague.
The airline recently discontinued twice-weekly flights scheduled to Helsinki via Palanga, but it plans to restart the routes.
